title: Impulse - Change in p from force-time equation

content.question: The net force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> exerted on an object that moves along a straight line is given as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> by <math alttext="F of t equals, A times t squared, plus B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi></math>, where <math alttext="A equals 1 newton per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>N/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and <math alttext="B equals 1 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>. What is the change in momentum of the object from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="12 kilomgram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="17 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>17</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="30 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilomgram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
